quest.name: Every Anden of the Rainbow
journal: Anden is deep in thought...or so one may assume. His face remains inscrutably leafy.
objectives: Travel to Fanow and wait for Anden to arrive.
Speak with Anden in Lydha Lran.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: You, Forename, travel far and wide as Ardbert once did...

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Tell me─what sort of encounter would leave one so forthright at a loss for words?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Meeting a talking shrub might do it.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: One with a person all too like myself.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: If you mean to ask about Ardbert, why not consult Seto instead?

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: That makes sense, given the circumstances. It's not every day one encounters a vocal leafman, or so I'm told.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Oooh, yes, that would certainly warrant some shock. Can you imagine another me running around somewhere, folious head and all? <shudder>

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Leafman hybrids notwithstanding, to meet your own reflection would be a rare experience indeed...

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Seto? Where have I heard that na─ Oh! Ardbert's amaro, was it?

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Wait a moment... I recognize a certain irony in my asking, but are you suggesting that this amaro can speak?

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: That's highly unusual, to say the least! I daresay I would be the one in shock if we ever were to meet.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Hmm... Rare occurrences... Unexpected meetings...

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: ...OOOH! That's why none of Eo Tyr's glamours felt quite right.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Forename! Call the faerie king─I think I've remembered who I am!

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Feo Ul! My most beautiful and beloved branch, I need you!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Work your magic, Feo Ul!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I call upon thy power, O great faerie king!

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: (-Feo Ul-)Oh, to be called so passionately by my sweetest sapling! My spirit is all song!

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: Of course, of course! Your branch has come to offer up the full extent of their power, just as they promised.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: Leafman─heed me well. If these magicks are to fail, you will melt into the earth as naught but an amalgamation of soil and grime. Have you remembered your true form, marrow to soul?

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Y-Yes! Yes, I have. I think!

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: Very well, then. Let us see what you become!

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: It worked! I'm a person! A real person!

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Just look at me! I haven't got roots or leaves or anything anymore! I'm free!

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: Ooooooh, Anden! True Anden! How I have missed you most of all Andens!

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: It makes sense, doesn't it? We men are hardly a common sight even amongst our own people. I'm sure Ardbert never expected to meet one of us out here!

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: It makes sense, doesn't it? Men such as I are hardly a common sight even amongst our own people. I'm sure Ardbert never expected to meet one of us out here!

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: It's all coming back to me now... I left the Greatwood to explore the outside world, came to Voeburt, met my very first sheep...and the rest is history.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: I was truly happy as a shepherd. If it were not for the Flood...

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: O-Of course─the Flood! My village, did it survive? I...I must go and see what became of it.

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: You're leaving, Anden? But you've never left...not even when those white beasties came to slurp you up and crunch your bones!

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: Leafless man─understand, we pixies are not wont to release the mortals we adore.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: As you yourself are one so favored by the fae, I grant you permission to remain in the Kingdom of Rainbows, if such is your wish. In your true and rightful form, of course.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: However, you are no longer bound to our land. You are free to travel the wide realm as does my brave sapling. Think carefully upon your decision, mortal, that you have no cause to regret it.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: Oh, I have so enjoyed this time with you, my adorable, dearest sapling. Let us meet again soon─yes, very soon!

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: Foolish, foolish Anden! Oooh, I can't let him leave... I shan't!

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Have you ever been to the Rak'tika Greatwood, Forename? I don't imagine you've had cause to visit the Viis settlements there...

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: An ally of Ronka!? And you've been to Fanow! Well, then...

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: My village is far deeper in the woods, but Fanow might well be a good place to start.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Would you be willing to accompany me that far? To be honest, I'm not sure I could explain myself with any credibility, if questioned...

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Thank you! Your presence is more reassuring than you know.

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: No! No, no, no, no, no! How could you, Anden!?

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: After I tried so hard to keep you safe! After I told the others to give you leaves and roots so those awful monsters couldn't touch you! So you could live happily ever after with your precious sheep!

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Y-You─? You turned me into a leafman to protect me?

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Oh, Eo Tyr...

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: ...My apologies, Forename. I think Eo Tyr and I need some time to speak alone. Go on ahead to Fanow, would you? I'll meet you there.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: There's no need to fret, Eo Tyr. I'm just going to visit, nothing more.

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: Oooh, I've heard that one before! They say Fanow is filled with pretty, pretty Viis! Lady Viis! You're going to leave forever and forget all about me!

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: I forbid it! You mustn't go! Oooh, Anden, please don't go!

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: There you are! I hope you weren't waiting overlong. It's been quite some time since I've navigated these woods...or had legs...

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: (-Intimidating Voice-)You, there! Halt!

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: (-Intimidating Woman-)...An unidentified male blundering gracelessly through the trees like a child. You're lucky the scout thought to call me before anyone else.

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: (-Intimidating Woman-)But to think we would meet again, Gilltet...

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Gilltet...?

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Ah, of course! Gilltet. Which makes you...Tellina?

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Er, it just came back to me─“Anden” is an assumed name, you see. My birth name is “Gilltet,” and this person who looks quite a lot like me is...

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: Tellina. Gilltet's younger sister. 'Tis an honor to make your acquaintance, ally of Ronka.

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: The forest spoke to me of your departure, but after the Flood... I had given up on ever seeing you again.

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: And to willingly part with your name is one thing, but to forget it entirely... What did the outside world do to you, Brother?

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Er... I-I don't know how to explain...

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: I hardly believe what I'm hearing, Gilltet.

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: While we were fleeing immitigable disaster, you were too captivated with your sheep to so much as seek shelter. Spared certain death only by the caprice of the fae, you've spent the intervening time as a leafman, blissfully unaware of your own existence...

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: “Immitigable disaster”? So our village, it...

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: Painful though it was, abandoning the village when we did spared many a fate worse than death.

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: ...Many, but not all. Some fell to sin eaters, while others have since left the woods as you did. You may not find many you recognize here, Gilltet.

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: If you decide to return to the Greatwood even so, however, I would welcome you.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: I, er, had best return to Il Mheg. Someone needs to look after the sheep.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: I also owe a great debt to someone there. The very same someone who transformed me, actually.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: I too assumed that they had made me into a leafman on a whim, but that's not the case. It was all to ensure that I wouldn't become something far worse─that even part of the true me might safely live on.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: To turn my back on them after that seems...gauche. But I would never abandon my little sister, either! Perhaps I can visit as my duties allow?

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: Unfettered yet honor-bound. Not even being changed into a bush could shake that from you, I see. Very well─come and visit when you have the chance. I'm sure the other girls would be glad of it.

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: Good Viis boys─or any Viis boys, for that matter─are in low supply these days, so I suggest you leave ere you find yourself swarmed by suitors. Unless that sounds like better fun than your sheep?

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: That goes for you as well, ally of Ronka. Between the two of you, I daresay you're the better catch.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Your sage guidance is noted, Sister! Truly, Tellina─I am glad to see you well. Let us speak again soon!

dialogue.name: TELLINA
dialogue.text: I had best return to the hunt...but you have my thanks.

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: <sniffle> He came back... <hic> Anden came hooome! <sob>

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: I'm glad we got out of there without any fuss. That smirk of Tellina's did not bode well for me...

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: I can't believe our village is gone...but I'm grateful to have seen my sister again.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: I even remembered my birth name! Always liked it, but when I left the forest I thought taking a local name would strengthen my resolve.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Thus, “Anden the shepherd” was born! A good, Voeburtite sheep-keep with a good, Voeburtite name.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: And seeing as I am still a Voeburtite sheep-keep─or close enough to one, anyway─I think I'll stay Anden for the time being.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Oooh, my thoughts are finally clear! Finally, I feel like my own self, true and whole. Thank you for helping me, Forename─I simply couldn't have done it without you.

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: Oooh, I'm so happy you came back, Anden! I was ready to throw you into a scary, sticky dream if you didn't.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Just as I promised. I can't wait to get back to shepherding─and I have a debt or two to repay where you're concerned, Eo Tyr.

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: Tee hee hee! Silly Anden─you don't owe me anything at all.

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: Don't you remember? You used to leave out little offerings of sheep's milk and sweeties all the time. Say that you remember!

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Oooh, I did, didn't I! I had heard tales of pixies that lived in these parts, so I made a point to leave them little things I thought they might enjoy. Call it a force of habit from my days attending woodland spirits. But you don't mean to say...

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: I do, Anden! Long ago, this land was ruled by people, and those people never really believed we pixies were anything more than clever little stories. And why should they? We always kept ourselves snugly out of sight with glamours.

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: But you believed in us. Kind, sweet, trusting Anden would always leave us treats and milk. Oooh, I'd never known such happiness.

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: So I watched over you always, Anden. Even when it was hard to─even when you were in such peril, but refused to leave your flock!

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: I couldn't watch you turn into one of those monsters. I had to do something to repay all your kind and generous gifts! That's why I turned you into a leafman. So you could stay safe and whole with the sheep you loved most.

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: But if you wish to thank me with bushels and bushels of adorable little things, Anden, I shan't say “no.” I can't say “no”! Not to you, my True and Lovely Anden!

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Oooh, that flattery of yours! But I can tell it would make you happy, and that rather makes me happy, so I'll prepare some milk and sweets for you again sometime.

dialogue.name: EOTYR
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! That's right, Anden! Dearest Anden! Let us live happily and together, forever and ever─and ever after and on!

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Well, the king said I should think carefully, and I believe I've reached a decision that suits me well.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Better than ever, in fact─mortals are fine, I suppose, but I feel freer amongst these fae folk. And now that I can hold things again, I can craft and trade for whatever my flock might need.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: ...The lurking leafmen iterations of my former colleagues─not to mention myself─are still rather unnerving, though!

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: Come to think of it, as long as I'm here, I may as well serve as a sort of guide for any mortals who unwittingly stumble into Il Mheg.

dialogue.name: ANDEN
dialogue.text: It's been quite awhile since I've had to consider such things, but...what are people wearing these days? No, wait─it may be best if you show me. If you find something that would make me look welcoming and approachable, I would be most happy to try it!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Future requests will be selected at random from all those you have seen thus far, with the list refreshed once a week (Earth time).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may review the items currently in demand at any time by speaking with Anden and selecting Make a delivery.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Note that lovely boxes of pretty things, lovely knickknacks, and Il Lydhas will earn you particularly handsome rewards. Whenever they make an appearance, the effort to procure them will be worth your while.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, Anden's appearance may now be altered through the use of glamours.
